Yeah, sorry, I was making my little consideration for bazel transpile a bit too much.

Far from being my favourite build system, cmake is far more widespread than bazel and less insane. I think Julia comes with a findjulia.cmake file, that lets you find libjulia if you want to build against it

text: Thanks, I appreciate it. My use case isn't to make something portable (that package managers would use), but rather have something that helps me build a custom system that runs in the cloud in containers / functions, etc., so I would stick with bazel for the time being. But it's good to know that there is some cmake support for Julia! I was hoping for something similar for bazal, like e.g. the bazel python rules here: <https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/python.html>
